h2.style: font-size: 20px; background-color: rgb(254, 192, 13); border-bottom: 8px solid rgb(186, 122, 30); font-family: asapbold; margin: 0px; padding: 7px;

a.title: COVID19info
a.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

strong.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.span: Rapid River is a quiet community at the junction of US 2 and US 41 in Delta County, Michigan. Our rural school prides itself on small class sizes, a dedicated & experienced teaching staff, and a positive school climate. Students have opportunities to be involved in a variety of sports and clubs. Our goal is to empower students to reach their greatest potential.

p.span:
** For a detailed calendar of our important parent, student, and district dates - select the "District" tab.
** You may access your student's schedule, lunch information, and more through PowerSchool using any internet connection.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial; font-size: 32px; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

This is the image for the news article titled Dual Enrollment

img.title: arrows
img.div: All students interested in dual enrollment for fall 2020 school year, please contact Mr. Warning at the high school office (906) 474-6411.

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Student Check In

img.title: arrows
img.div: ALL middle/high school students need to check both their Google email and Google classroom for information regarding class information.
img.a: Read More about Student Check In

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Free Breakfast & Lunch

img.title: arrows
img.div: FREE bag breakfast and lunch for ALL Rapid River students. Pickup in the back parking lot by the library every Monday (2:00 pm - 6:00 pm) until school opens. Each pick up will include 5 bag breakfasts and 5 bag lunches per child.
img.a: Read More about Free Breakfast & Lunch
